title: Le Grand Vizir Iznogoud
desc: Iznogoud plots his first big scheme to overthrow the Caliph and become "Grand Vizir Iznogoud." Full of inventive traps and comedic frustration as his plans backfire, it sets the tone for his obsessive rivalry with the Caliph.

title: Les Complots du grand vizir Iznogoud
englishTitle: The Schemes of Grand Vizier Iznogoud
desc: Iznogoud concocts increasingly elaborate conspiracies—from contraptions to cursed objects—to derail the Caliph, often sabotaged by chance or his own hubris. The creative setups and recurring gags establish the classic formula: Iznogoud’s wild plans, comedic misfires, and the Caliph’s oblivious ease.

title: Les Vacances du calife
desc: Iznogoud tries to spoil the Caliph’s holiday with hidden dangers—from booby‑trapped beaches to cursed excursions—but each mischievous ploy backfires. Vacation paradise becomes a playground for Iznogoud’s mischief and inevitable comeuppance.

title: Iznogoud l'infâme
desc: "Iznogoud the infamous" doubles down on the character’s cunning: elaborate evil devices, hidden mazes, and secret poisons. Beneath the title’s grandeur lies the usual farce, as every snare snaps on Iznogoud himself.

title: Des astres pour Iznogoud
desc: Set under celestial omens, this volume has Iznogoud manipulating comets, astrologers, and cosmic phenomena. Mischiefs and cosmic magnification add flair—but his schemes tumble, and astrology proves another bugbear rather than weapon.

title: Iznogoud et l'Ordinateur magique
desc: In an anachronistic twist, this album introduces a "magic computer" to forecast Iznogoud’s best opportunity. He programs outrageous plots, but the futuristic machine proves glitchy—and fate once again laughs at his ambitions.

title: Une Carotte pour Iznogoud
desc: Iznogoud invents carrot‑based contrivances—giant carrots, explosive roots, enchanted vegetables—to trap the Caliph. The absurd theme lampoons both his obsession and kitchen‑garden logic. Humorous mishaps and root riot reign.

title: Le Jour des fous
desc: On "Fools’ Day," chaos reigns. Iznogoud creates spectacles of madness: carnival chaos, bizarre laws, and fake royal decrees. But the inversion of power only amplifies his frustration when he still can’t seize the throne.

title: Le Tapis magique
desc: A magic flying carpet becomes Iznogoud’s tool of choice—until his nitpicking sabotage lands him in mid‑air without a ride. High‑flying pratfalls and visual gags mark this vibrant tale.

title: Iznogoud l'acharné
desc: "The Choleric One" is more determined than ever. Every trap is amplified in scale and malice. Yet his own impatience, stubbornness, and temper prove more destructive than fate.

title: La Tête de turc d'Iznogoud
desc: Iznogoud strives to make the Caliph a scapegoat. Schemes involve forged letters, contrived incidents, and political manipulation. But for all his plotting, the only one left holding the blame is… Iznogoud.

title: Le Conte de fées d'Iznogoud
desc: In this fairy-tale parody, Iznogoud dabbles in enchanted lands, spellbound creatures, and a magic mirror to unseat the Caliph. But like in all classic fables, his greed and trickery earn him a fittingly ironic ending.

title: Je veux être calife à la place du calife
englishTitle: I Want to Be Caliph Instead of the Caliph
desc: The catchphrase becomes the central theme. Iznogoud attempts multiple plots in rapid succession—time machines, deadly potions, shape-shifting. Each wild idea collapses hilariously as the Caliph remains oblivious and cheerful.

title: Les Cauchemars d'Iznogoud (Tome 1)
desc: A darker and more surreal tone emerges as Iznogoud endures a series of literal nightmares. His subconscious plays cruel tricks, blending horror and comedy as his obsession turns against him.

title: L'Enfance d'Iznogoud
desc: A rare flashback episode: we glimpse Iznogoud’s youth, already manipulative and ambitious. His childhood schemes mirror his adult failures, proving he was always destined to be the loser of his own plans.

title: Iznogoud et les Femmes
desc: Iznogoud turns to charming royal women and empresses as tools in his coup attempts. But romance proves as tricky as politics, and the women turn out wiser than he expected.

title: Les Cauchemars d'Iznogoud (Tome 4)
desc: More surreal dream sequences plague Iznogoud, from upside-down kingdoms to monstrous clones. The absurdity escalates, and dreams bleed into reality—confusing even Iznogoud about what’s real.

title: Le Complice d'Iznogoud
desc: A mysterious stranger offers to help Iznogoud with his mission. But trusting someone as devious as himself is dangerous—and this "ally" may want the throne too…

title: L'Anniversaire d'Iznogoud
desc: On his birthday, Iznogoud is gifted a chance to become Caliph—but it’s cursed. Every attempt to use it ends in disaster. His special day becomes a comedy of errors.

title: Iznogoud enfin calife !
desc: He finally becomes Caliph—but only for a moment. A classic reversal tale where Iznogoud gets everything he wanted... and promptly ruins it. Be careful what you wish for!

title: Le Piège de la sirène
desc: A seductive siren tempts Iznogoud with magic and promises. Predictably, he’s manipulated into self-destruction, with the sea claiming another one of his failed ambitions.

title: Les Cauchemars d'Iznogoud (Tome 2)
desc: A mid-series "lost" nightmare tale. More hallucinations and comic horror as Iznogoud endures curses, endless loops, and doppelgangers. He tries to escape the dreams, but they chase him back.

title: Les Cauchemars d'Iznogoud (Tome 3)
desc: Iznogoud is trapped in bizarre dreamscapes once again—riddles, reflections, and alternate versions of himself. A surreal, almost psychedelic volume where his worst fears come true… over and over.

title: Les Retours d'Iznogoud
desc: Past schemes come back to haunt Iznogoud. Former characters return, old curses resurface, and past mistakes repeat themselves. The Caliph forgets—but Iznogoud’s failures never fade.

title: Qui a tué le calife ?
desc: A murder mystery twist! The Caliph disappears, and Iznogoud is a suspect. He wishes he were guilty—but for once, he’s innocent. Now he must prove it... while secretly hoping the Caliph stays missing.

title: Un Monstre sympathique
desc: Iznogoud befriends a kind but terrifying monster he hopes to weaponize. But the beast’s innocence thwarts every malicious plan. Heartwarming chaos ensues as the monster helps—but ruins—Iznogoud’s schemes.

title: La Faute de l'ancêtre
desc: An ancient family curse may explain Iznogoud’s eternal failure. He tries to break the curse and rewrite history—but meddling with ancestry only multiplies his misfortune.

title: Les Mille et Une Nuits du Calife
englishTitle: The Caliph’s Thousand and One Nights
desc: In a tribute to Arabian Nights, the Caliph tells enchanted tales, each a parody or trap for Iznogoud. Richly layered stories within stories showcase clever twists and poetic justice.

title: Iznogoud président
desc: Iznogoud runs for election in a parody of modern politics. Campaign slogans, false promises, and dirty tricks abound. Yet the public adores the Caliph’s simplicity over Iznogoud’s cunning speeches.

title: De père en fils !
desc: Iznogoud’s legacy continues—perhaps through a son or reincarnation. A generational twist sees his ambitions mirrored in the next era. But the curse of failure, too, may be inherited…

title: Moi, calife...
desc: He finally gets the throne, or so it seems. But wielding power is far harder than stealing it. Bureaucracy, responsibility, and expectation break him—and the Caliph returns to peace.

title: Des bougies pour Iznogoud
desc: A birthday episode full of magical candles, each with a wish. Iznogoud thinks he’s found his perfect weapon, but the wishes turn twisted and backfire, one by one.

title: Iznogoud et la sœur du calife
desc: A new character—Caliph’s sister—enters the palace. Iznogoud tries to use her for influence, manipulation, or marriage plots. But she’s smarter than him and turns the tables with wit and charm.

title: Gala de gaffes à gogo
desc: Gaston Lagaffe unleashes a spectacular display of blunders—from exploding inventions to office mayhem. This early collection highlights his eccentric genius and total disregard for workplace norms. Prunelle's patience wears thin as chaos multiplies. A comic showcase of misfires and visual gags that define Lagaffe’s anti-workplace rebellion.

title: Gare aux gaffes du gars gonflé
desc: Gaston continues his crusade against order with inflatables, failed gadgets, and surreal logic. His tireless energy leaves destruction in his wake—crumpling desks, botching deliveries, and enraging Prunelle. The album amplifies his personality: part inventor, part catastrophe. A must for fans of slapstick and absurdist office satire.

title: Gaffes à gogo
desc: A classic volume full of inventions gone awry, animal mishaps, and distracted doodling. Gaston’s laid-back attitude collides hilariously with deadlines and bureaucracy. This album establishes many iconic gags, showcasing Franquin’s impeccable timing and clean-line artwork. The chaos feels boundless, but always gentle and charming.

title: Les Gaffes d’un gars gonflé
desc: Gaston’s inflating ego matches the inflatables he builds—balloons, beds, even a car safety device. His careless enthusiasm affects everything around him, especially the unlucky office staff. The tension between invention and destruction defines this collection, blending physical comedy with sly office observations.

title: Le Bureau des gaffes en gros
desc: The office descends into full anarchy. Gaston introduces absurd paperwork systems and explosive prototypes, baffling his coworkers. More animals join the fray—including a cat and a gull. Franquin’s gags become more elaborate and visually dense, creating a vivid portrait of organized disorder.

title: Des gaffes et des dégâts
desc: Gaston’s antics escalate from quirky to borderline catastrophic. Whether causing electrical outages or demolishing furniture, he manages to dodge consequences with an innocent smile. This album emphasizes escalating visual absurdity, clever build-ups, and near-miss slapstick. Franquin begins pushing the boundaries of conventional comic pacing.

title: Un gaffeur sachant gaffer
desc: A masterclass in gaffes: Gaston hits his stride as the undisputed king of workplace mayhem. His inventions are bigger, louder, and more unpredictable. Reactions from co-workers—Prunelle, Lebrac, Longtarin—are as hilarious as the setups. The pacing is sharp, with Franquin’s art reaching new expressive heights.

title: Lagaffe nous gâte
desc: Gaston "treats" the office with new gifts: defective gadgets, musical catastrophes, and wild animals. His goodwill turns destructive in the most comic ways. Franquin juxtaposes Gaston’s sweetness with the chaos he unintentionally unleashes. The volume showcases the series’ blend of gentle character humor and explosive farce.

title: Le Cas Lagaffe
desc: Gaston becomes a case study in dysfunction. His behavior borders on performance art—crashing meetings, frying equipment, and staging strange demonstrations. This volume dives deeper into his psychology: dreamer, rebel, and chaos artist. The reactions grow sharper, but the affection for Gaston never wavers.

title: Le Géant de la gaffe
desc: Gaston reaches "giant" proportions with increasingly outrageous pranks. From fire hazards to failed green energy inventions, every gag escalates absurdly. The title plays on both his scale of disasters and his beloved status. A peak example of Franquin’s visual humor, inventiveness, and critique of modern office life.

title: Gaffes, bévues et boulettes
desc: This volume overflows with Gaston’s most jaw-dropping gaffes. From botched deliveries to electrical disasters, nothing escapes his trail of mishaps. Franquin tightens the visual punchlines and delivers running gags at full speed. It’s a comedic parade of slips, flops, and blunders that become almost poetic in their absurdity.

title: Le Gang des gaffeurs
desc: Gaston finds kindred spirits—fellow slackers, artists, and oddballs—who fuel his anti-work ethos. Together, they transform the office into a creative (and chaotic) playground. The gags gain more character depth, with playful critiques of conformity and corporate dullness. An ode to rebellion, friendship, and imaginative dysfunction.

title: Lagaffe mérite des baffes
desc: Prunelle and others finally reach their breaking point. Gaston’s innocence now earns visible rage, not just sighs. Physical comedy intensifies, and tempers explode—literally. Yet the humor remains warm, never mean-spirited. The volume explores the fine balance between affection and frustration that defines Gaston’s world.

title: La Saga des gaffes
desc: An epic compilation of Gaston’s greatest gaffes. This “saga” features callbacks to earlier inventions, evolving gags, and expanded set pieces. Franquin plays with pacing, visual echoes, and more elaborate setups. It’s a celebration of creative failure and the enduring charm of a hero who never learns.

title: Gaffe à Lagaffe !
desc: A warning and a promise: Gaston’s gags become wilder, louder, and messier. Explosive soup cans, musical disasters, and rubber gadgets fill the pages. This volume showcases peak slapstick, with cascading reactions and brilliant timing. The office, by now, feels like a war zone of well-meaning incompetence.

title: En direct de la gaffe
desc: Gaston goes “live,” as if broadcasting his chaos in real time. The gags feel faster, more reactive, and self-aware. There’s a meta edge—he seems to know we’re watching. Franquin plays with breaking the fourth wall, creating a vibrant, almost theatrical comic full of surprises.

title: Le lourd passé de Lagaffe
desc: Gaston’s past mistakes return to haunt the present. Old inventions reappear, unfinished projects backfire, and long-forgotten gags resurface unexpectedly. It’s a comedic exploration of consequences in a world where nothing ever really gets finished—or thrown away. The past is heavy… and still ticking!

title: Gaffe à la vache !
desc: Gaston meets a cow. Chaos ensues. From animal care to bovine logistics, every attempt to help turns bizarre. This quirky volume highlights Gaston’s love for animals—and total lack of practicality. It’s an unusually rural twist to office-based humor, filled with manure, mooing, and miscommunication.

title: La saga des gaffes
desc:
Présente-t-on Gaston Lagaffe ? Ce personnage rêveur et inventif, aux trouvailles aussi inattendues que catastrophiques, est l'un des plus fameux de toute la bande dessinée. Qu'il se mêle d'améliorer la vie de bureau, de s'occuper d'un chat ou d'une mouette, d'inventer des instruments de musique ou de perfectionner sa voiture, Gaston déclenche immanquablement explosions, incendies et désastres, pour la plus grande joie de lecteurs écroulés de rire.
Créée par le grand André Franquin, une série incontournable de la BD, à mettre d'urgence dans les mains de tous ceux, petits et grands, qui ne la connaitraient pas encore.

Cette toute nouvelle édition de la collection Gaston Lagaffe intègre toutes les planches réalisées par André Franquin, certaines inédites. Chacune d'elle a été minutieusement remasterisée d'après le trait original, et délicieusement recoloriée au plus près des souhaits de l'auteur.

title: Ultimes bévues
desc:
Présente-t-on Gaston Lagaffe ? Ce personnage rêveur et inventif, aux trouvailles aussi inattendues que catastrophiques, est l'un des plus fameux de toute la bande dessinée. Qu'il se mêle d'améliorer la vie de bureau, de s'occuper d'un chat ou d'une mouette, d'inventer des instruments de musique ou de perfectionner sa voiture, Gaston déclenche immanquablement explosions, incendies et désastres, pour la plus grande joie de lecteurs écroulés de rire.
Créée par le grand André Franquin, une série incontournable de la BD, à mettre d'urgence dans les mains de tous ceux, petits et grands, qui ne la connaitraient pas encore.

Cette toute nouvelle édition de la collection Gaston Lagaffe intègre toutes les planches réalisées par André Franquin, certaines inédites. Chacune d'elle a été minutieusement remasterisée d'après le trait original, et délicieusement recoloriée au plus près des souhaits de l'auteur.

title: Le retour de Lagaffe
desc: After a long pause, Lagaffe is back. The gags feel nostalgic yet sharp, reviving classic rhythms with updated flair. There’s new commentary on technology, bureaucracy, and the timeless struggle between creativity and control. The return proves that Gaston’s charm—and destructive genius—never really left.

title: La mine d’or de Dick Digger
desc: Lucky Luke helps his old friend Dick Digger reclaim his stolen gold mine from bandits. This early tale introduces themes of loyalty, greed, and frontier justice. A classic Western revenge plot with light humor and quick gunplay.

title: Rodéo
desc: Lucky Luke joins a rodeo and confronts cheating competitors. He foils a stagecoach robbery and a crooked rancher. A collection of loosely connected stories, it mixes rodeo stunts, humor, and frontier justice.

title: Arizona
desc: In the lawless towns of Arizona, Lucky Luke restores peace by defeating several outlaws and corrupt officials. The tone blends slapstick with gritty duels. It’s a showcase of Luke's sharpshooting and unshakable sense of fairness.

title: Sous le ciel de l’Ouest
desc: Lucky Luke faces storms, outlaws, and restless settlers in this wild frontier tale. A series of episodes where nature, man, and chaos threaten peace—only to be calmly subdued by Luke’s cool demeanor and quick draw.

title: Lucky Luke contre Pat Poker
desc: Gambler and outlaw Pat Poker cheats his way to power in two towns. Lucky Luke cleans up both, confronting him twice. Cleverly plotted with gambling motifs, it’s one of the earliest recurring villain arcs.

title: Hors‑la‑loi
desc: Luke hunts the notorious Dalton gang (the original ones) and brings them to justice. This album sets the stage for the later, more famous Dalton cousins. It’s a classic manhunt with grim tones and sharp duels.

title: L’élixir du Dr Doxey
desc: A conman doctor sells fake medicine across the West. Lucky Luke exposes the scheme, chasing Doxey and his assistant through towns and carnivals. A satirical jab at miracle cures and traveling salesmen.

title: Lucky Luke contre Phil Defer
desc: Luke faces off with Phil Defer (Wire), a gunslinger with a deadly reputation. The showdown escalates in a quiet town turned battleground. A suspenseful Western about fear, bluffing, and reputation.

title: Des rails sur la Prairie
desc: Luke protects a railroad construction crew from sabotage. Rivals and rustlers try to stop the tracks. A tribute to American expansionism, this story blends engineering, action, and humor in the wild prairie.

title: Alerte aux Pieds‑Bleus
desc: A peace treaty is threatened by manipulative traders who provoke Native tribes. Lucky Luke uncovers the plot and restores peace. A sensitive and humorous take on diplomacy and deception in the Old West.

title: Lucky Luke contre Joss Jamon
desc: Joss Jamon and his gang take over a town through fake democracy and intimidation. Luke uncovers the scam and restores order. A satire on politics, corruption, and frontier justice.

title: Les Cousins Dalton
desc: The bumbling cousins of the original Daltons make their debut. More comic than criminal, they become recurring foes. Lucky Luke faces their chaos with patience and pistol. Their incompetence becomes legendary.

title: Le Juge
desc: Judge Roy Bean imposes bizarre laws and unfair rulings in his town. Lucky Luke exposes the mock justice and restores real law. A witty parody of judicial abuse with eccentric Western flavor.

title: Ruée sur l’Oklahoma
desc: Luke oversees a massive land rush as settlers claim new territory. Cheating, sabotage, and legal wrangling threaten peace. A fast-paced adventure about fairness, freedom, and the law in a growing nation.

title: L’Évasion des Dalton
desc: The Dalton cousins escape from prison and return to crime. Lucky Luke must recapture them through towns, canyons, and disguises. Their antics grow more ridiculous, but still dangerous.

title: En remontant le Mississippi
desc: Lucky Luke navigates a riverboat journey to stop steamboat sabotage. Gambling, river pirates, and deceit abound. A colorful tale set on America’s iconic river, with nods to Mark Twain and paddlewheel adventure.

title: Sur la piste des Dalton
desc: After another escape, the Daltons hide among settlers. Lucky Luke uses tracking and trickery to locate them. A cat-and-mouse chase through rough terrain with clever traps and comic pitfalls.

title: À l’ombre des derricks
englishTitle: In the Shadow of the Derricks
desc: Oil is discovered, and a sleepy town erupts into a gold-rush frenzy. Luke investigates fraud and keeps the peace. A sharp parody of oil speculation and the madness of sudden wealth.

title: Les Rivaux de Painful Gulch
desc: Two feuding families shoot at each other for the smallest slight. Luke tries to end the feud using wit and distraction. A classic comic take on the Hatfield–McCoy-style vendetta.

title: Billy the Kid
desc: Luke is tasked with taming the bratty, gun-toting Billy the Kid. This famous outlaw is portrayed as a childish narcissist. A comedic showdown between maturity and megalomania.

title: Les Collines noires
desc: Lucky Luke escorts scientists surveying land claimed by Native tribes. Tensions rise as gold is found. A thoughtful take on colonial pressure, greed, and mutual understanding.

title: Les Dalton dans le blizzard
desc: The Daltons flee to Canada. Luke pursues them through snow, Mounties, and cold misadventures. A cross-border chase filled with Canadian culture and wintery slapstick.

title: Les Dalton courent toujours
englishTitle: The Daltons Always on the Run
desc: Once again escaped, the Daltons run amok through towns and farms. Luke’s pursuit involves tricking them into surrender. This volume emphasizes repetition as a comic tool.

title: La Caravane
desc: Luke leads a caravan of settlers west, facing sandstorms, buffalo, and sabotage. A warm and chaotic story of camaraderie, challenges, and perseverance across the vast plains.

title: La Ville fantôme
desc: Luke visits a deserted town taken over by crooks using ghost stories to scare people away. He uncovers the plot and revives the town. A spooky-comic Western mystery.

title: Les Dalton se rachètent
desc: Given a chance to reform, the Daltons try to live honest lives—but crime keeps calling. Lucky Luke monitors their progress in a town full of temptation. A comic study in nature vs. nurture.

title: Le Vingtième de cavalerie
desc: Luke mediates between the US Cavalry and Native tribes after a treaty is broken. A story of diplomacy, betrayal, and military bluster, featuring large battles and moral nuance.

title: L’Escorte
desc: Luke escorts an outlaw to trial, facing ambushes and bribery. A tense road trip with witty dialogue, desert dangers, and recurring escape attempts. Justice takes the scenic route.

title: Des barbelés sur la prairie
desc: Farmers and ranchers clash over land use. Luke introduces barbed wire to divide peacefully, but tensions escalate. A sharp look at changing technology in the West.

title: Calamity Jane
desc: The legendary frontierswoman teams up with Lucky Luke to stop smugglers. Her wild temper and bravery shine in this feminist-flavored adventure with action and respect.

title: Tortillas pour les Dalton
desc: The Daltons flee to Mexico, where Lucky Luke chases them through fiestas, deserts, and revolutions. A fiesta of cultural references and cross-border hijinks.

title: La Diligence
desc: Luke guards a stagecoach carrying valuables and colorful passengers. Bandits, sabotage, and secrets fill the journey. A Western mystery full of mistrust and misdirection.

title: Le Pied‑tendre
desc: An English aristocrat tries cowboy life in the Wild West—with disastrous results. Luke helps him navigate duels, poker, and manners. A cultural comedy of errors.

title: Dalton City
desc: The Daltons start their own outlaw town. Luke infiltrates to restore law and order. A satirical look at society when crooks make the rules.

title: Jesse James
desc: Luke faces the infamous outlaw, who sees himself as a Robin Hood figure. Jesse’s charm masks cunning crimes. An ideological duel of justice vs. outlaw myth.

title: Western Circus
desc: Luke accompanies a circus traveling through the West, defending it from sabotage by rival showmen. Acrobats, clowns, and chaos ride together in this big-top Western.

title: Canyon Apache
desc: Luke tries to broker peace with an Apache tribe after a misunderstanding causes conflict. Respectful and nuanced, this tale highlights cultural tensions and trust-building.

title: Ma Dalton
desc: The Dalton brothers’ mother joins their antics, proving more ruthless than her sons. Luke struggles to outwit the whole family in this matriarchal mayhem.

title: Chasseur de primes
desc: Luke is joined by a ruthless bounty hunter. Their clashing values—law vs. greed—drive tension as they pursue the same outlaw. A moral commentary wrapped in action.

title: Le Grand Duc
desc: A Russian noble visits the West, hoping for cowboy thrills. Luke guides him through staged adventures, until real danger strikes. A playful jab at aristocratic fantasy.

title: L’Héritage de Rantanplan
desc: The dim-witted dog Rantanplan inherits a fortune, making him a target. Luke must protect the oblivious pup from schemers in a comedy of canine confusion.

title: 7 histoires complètes (série 1)
desc: A collection of seven short stories: train heists, saloon scams, dog chases, and quick jokes. A sampler of Lucky Luke humor in bite-sized form.

title: Le Cavalier blanc
desc: A masked vigilante dispenses justice in the West. Is he friend or foe? Luke uncovers the mystery behind the hero’s identity. A parody of superheroes in cowboy boots.

title: La Guérison des Dalton
desc: A psychologist claims he can reform the Daltons. Luke supervises their treatment in a controlled town. A comic debate on therapy vs. reality for criminals.

title: L’Empereur Smith
desc: A madman declares himself Emperor of the West. Luke must topple his empire built on ego and fake gold. A political satire of ambition gone wild.

title: Le Fil qui chante
desc: Telegraph lines cross the West, sparking sabotage and fear of change. Luke protects the workers and technology. A tribute to communication’s advance in the frontier.

title: La Ballade des Dalton (hors-série)
englishTitle: The Ballad of the Daltons (Special Issue)
desc: A musical and cinematic tale as the Daltons must fulfill a will. Luke tags along on this satirical, self-aware Western caper.

title: La Corde du pendu
desc: Luke confronts a town where a corrupt judge sentences too quickly. Justice, mercy, and frontier law clash in this darker-toned tale.

title: Daisy Town
desc: A gold rush makes Daisy Town bloom—and criminals follow. Luke restores order and keeps the peace. Adapted from the animated film with classic elements.

title: La Ballade des Dalton et autres histoires
englishTitle: The Ballad of the Daltons and Other Stories
desc: A collection featuring the titular Ballad plus more Dalton antics and Western parodies. Light, varied, and filled with familiar humor.

title: Tintin au pays des Soviets
englishTitle: Tintin in the Land of the Soviets
desc: Tintin travels to the Soviet Union to report on the communist regime. He uncovers corruption, staged propaganda, and state-run cruelty. A rough but spirited debut, this volume is action-heavy and politically blunt, showcasing Tintin’s courage and Herge’s early anti-totalitarian message.

title: Tintin au Congo
desc: Tintin is sent to the Belgian Congo, where he combats criminals and explores colonial Africa. Though full of slapstick and jungle encounters, the album reflects outdated racial stereotypes. Controversial today, it reveals more about the era than the characters. Still, Tintin’s loyalty and bravery shine.

title: Tintin en Amérique
desc: Tintin heads to the United States, confronting gangsters in Chicago and oil barons in the Wild West. He clashes with Al Capone and exposes crime while navigating Native American land disputes. The album blends satire, slapstick, and action in Herge’s growing critique of exploitation.

title: Les Cigares du pharaon
desc: On a cruise, Tintin stumbles into an international drug-smuggling ring involving ancient tombs, curses, and a secret society. With mysterious symbols, sarcophagi, and surreal hallucinations, this marks the series’ first real mystery thriller—and the introduction of detectives Thomson and Thompson.

title: Le Lotus bleu
desc: A direct sequel to Cigares du pharaon, this story sends Tintin to 1930s China. He uncovers a Japanese invasion plot and battles drug traffickers. Politically sharp and culturally respectful, Lotus Bleu is a turning point in Herge’s storytelling maturity and worldbuilding.

title: L'Oreille cassée
desc: Tintin investigates a stolen Arumbaya fetish, leading to jungle treks, civil wars, and arms dealers in South America. A sharp satire of colonial meddling and war profiteering, the album mixes action with subtle political critique. Tintin’s disguise work and ingenuity shine here.

title: L'Île Noire
desc: After being attacked, Tintin follows a counterfeiting ring to Scotland. Foggy cliffs, a ruined castle, and a mysterious gorilla guard the truth. This moody thriller is a fan favorite for its Gothic atmosphere, classic sleuthing, and dramatic seaside setting.

title: Le Sceptre d'Ottokar
desc: Tintin uncovers a plot to overthrow the king of Syldavia, a fictional Eastern European country. Political intrigue, espionage, and symbolic patriotism fill the pages. A prelude to WWII tensions, it’s also the first to show Tintin as a defender of democracy and justice.

title: Le Crabe aux pinces d'or
englishTitle: The Crab with the Golden Claws
desc: A chance clue in a crab tin leads Tintin into a drug ring—and into the desert. He meets Captain Haddock, who becomes his lifelong companion. Between drunken escapades and camel chases, this album marks a new dynamic in the series.

title: L'Étoile mystérieuse
desc: A strange meteorite crashes into the sea, sparking an international scientific race. Tintin and Haddock join the expedition, encountering odd natural phenomena and rival crews. A blend of science fiction and Cold War competition, the story is surreal, symbolic, and tension-filled.

title: Le Secret de La Licorne
desc: Tintin discovers a clue to pirate treasure hidden inside a model ship. With Captain Haddock, he follows a mystery linked to Haddock’s ancestor. Intrigue, research, and riddles drive the plot. The beginning of one of the series’ most iconic duologies.

title: Le Trésor de Rackham le Rouge
desc: Continuing from Licorne, Tintin and Haddock search for buried treasure. They discover Professor Calculus and take to the sea in a shark-shaped submarine. This album combines adventure with humor and introduces Calculus, another series regular. It concludes the treasure-hunt saga with charm and closure.

title: Les Sept Boules de cristal
desc: An ancient Inca mummy’s curse strikes seven explorers who opened his tomb—each falls into a coma after a mysterious crystal ball attack. Tintin investigates the supernatural puzzle while Professor Calculus is kidnapped. A suspenseful and eerie tale, it sets up the direct sequel.

title: Le Temple du Soleil
desc: Tintin and Haddock journey through Peru to rescue Calculus, held captive by descendants of the Inca civilization. The quest includes jungle dangers, ancient rituals, and solar eclipses. Rich in Andean culture and atmosphere, it’s one of the most cinematic and suspenseful Tintin stories.

title: Tintin au pays de l'or noir
desc: A fuel crisis leads Tintin to the Middle East, where he uncovers a plot to sabotage oil supplies. He encounters old enemies like Dr. Müller and rescues abducted children. Blending desert adventure with political intrigue, it also introduces Emir Ben Kalish Ezab and his mischievous son, Abdullah.

title: Objectif Lune
desc: Tintin, Haddock, and Calculus travel to Syldavia where Calculus is building a rocket. Espionage threatens the secretive space project. Grounded in real science, the album focuses on pre-launch preparations, showcasing Herge’s research and ambition. A rare science-fiction arc that sets the stage for lunar adventure.

title: On a marché sur la Lune
desc: Tintin, Haddock, Calculus, and friends journey to the Moon. From weightless hijinks to hidden saboteurs, danger follows the crew. The story mixes tension, heroism, and sacrifice. Among Herge’s most scientifically accurate and emotionally complex stories, it was a visionary tale years before the actual Moon landing.

title: L'Affaire Tournesol
desc: Professor Calculus invents a sonic weapon and becomes a pawn in Cold War espionage between fictional nations Syldavia and Borduria. Tintin and Haddock race to rescue him from secret police. A spy thriller filled with suspense, gadgets, and political satire—one of the most beloved Tintin adventures.

title: Coke en stock
desc: Tintin investigates a modern slavery and arms-trafficking ring in the Middle East. Several old characters reappear in an explosive plot about deceit, oil, and warlords. Captain Haddock plays a strong role in a story rich with action, dark themes, and biting commentary on geopolitics and human exploitation.

title: Tintin au Tibet
desc: Tintin dreams that his friend Chang is alive after a plane crash in the Himalayas. Refusing to believe otherwise, he and Haddock face snowstorms, avalanches, and the Yeti. A moving, introspective story about friendship, belief, and perseverance. Herge’s most personal and spiritual album.

title: Les Bijoux de la Castafiore
desc: A rare “anti-adventure” album where nothing happens—but everything goes wrong. A mystery unfolds around Castafiore’s missing jewel, media chaos, and Haddock’s foot injury. A satirical take on fame, gossip, and expectations. No exotic location—just sharp wit, misdirection, and domestic disasters at Marlinspike Hall.

title: Vol 714 pour Sydney
desc: Tintin and company are hijacked and taken to a remote island by a cult-like organization seeking alien contact. Blending sci-fi with espionage, hypnosis, and surrealism, this story is divisive but visually stunning. A rare look into the paranormal in the Tintin series.

title: Tintin et les Picaros
desc: Tintin returns to South America to rescue friends falsely imprisoned by a military dictatorship. He joins rebels in the jungle, but stays skeptical of revolution. A late-series critique of both sides of political conflict, showing a more passive Tintin caught in modern disillusionment.

title: Tintin et l'Alph-Art
desc: Herge’s final and unfinished album. Tintin investigates a murder in the modern art world and uncovers a sinister cult. The story ends on a cliffhanger, with Tintin at the mercy of the villain. Left as sketches and dialogue, it gives a glimpse into Herge’s evolving direction.

title: Astérix le Gaulois
desc: In the small village resisting Roman occupation, Astérix uses a magic potion to thwart Roman plans. The first album introduces key characters and humor. Simple and experimental, it sets the stage for a legendary series centered on Gaulish resistance and clever satire.

title: La Serpe d’or
desc: When Getafix's golden sickle breaks, Astérix and Obélix travel to Lutetia (Paris) to replace it. They uncover a smuggling racket and clash with bandits. A mix of urban parody, crime mystery, and road trip, it expands the Gaulish universe.

title: Astérix et les Goths
desc: Astérix and Obélix journey into Germanic territory to rescue Getafix, kidnapped by the war-loving Goths. The story mocks militarism, nationalism, and cultural clichés, setting a pattern for international adventures and stereotypes with a humorous twist.

title: Astérix gladiateur
desc: When bard Cacofonix is kidnapped to amuse Caesar, Astérix and Obélix sail to Rome, join a gladiator school, and turn the Colosseum into a chaotic comedy show. A Roman satire blending action, parody, and slapstick.

title: Le Tour de Gaule d’Astérix
desc: After a Roman blockade, Astérix and Obélix travel around Gaul collecting regional delicacies to prove their freedom. A culinary and cultural road trip parodying French pride, with each stop satirizing local quirks. A fan favorite.

title: Astérix et Cléopâtre
desc: Summoned by Cleopatra, Getafix builds a palace in 3 months to win a bet against Caesar. A lush adventure full of Egyptian satire, ancient architecture, and comic rivalry. The story inspired a hugely popular animated film.

title: Le Combat des chefs
desc: When Getafix loses his memory, the village faces a ritual combat challenge without magic potion. Astérix must outwit a rival chief and the Romans. A clever take on leadership, memory loss, and brute strength.

title: Astérix chez les Bretons
desc: Astérix and Obélix cross the Channel to aid British cousins resisting Roman rule. With puns on tea, queues, and British politeness, it’s a hilarious cultural exchange highlighting stereotypes with warmth and wit.

title: Astérix et les Normands
desc: Normans arrive in Gaul to learn the meaning of fear. A timid visitor, Cacofonix’s singing, and Astérix’s cleverness combine in a comedic clash of cultures. The Normans' literal-mindedness and thirst for fear drive the absurdity.

title: Astérix légionnaire
desc: To rescue Obélix’s love interest’s fiancé, the duo joins the Roman army in Africa. Their antics disrupt legion discipline. Packed with military humor, international recruits, and desert misadventures, it’s a brilliant spoof on army life.

title: Le Bouclier arverne
desc: Vercingetorix’s lost shield resurfaces in Roman hands. Astérix and Obélix search for it in Arverne (Auvergne), encountering prideful locals and hidden resistance. It’s a patriotic tale full of regional satire and ancient pride.

title: Astérix aux Jeux olympiques
desc: Astérix and Obélix represent Gaul in the ancient Olympics. Romans try to sabotage their chances, but teamwork and cleverness triumph. A sports parody with commentary on doping, cheating, and national ego.

title: Astérix et le Chaudron
desc: Tasked with guarding a corrupt chief’s money-filled cauldron, Astérix fails and is exiled. He tries various schemes to repay the debt, leading to chaos and satire on capitalism. A darker, more cynical adventure than usual.

title: Astérix en Hispanie
desc: Astérix and Obélix escort a rebellious Spanish boy home. The tale pokes fun at Spanish traditions, pride, and Roman attempts to control Iberia. With bullfighting, flamenco, and stubbornness, it’s a vibrant cultural satire.

title: La Zizanie
desc: A Roman agent sows discord in the village by spreading rumors. The Gauls’ unity breaks down until Astérix unmasks the plot. A hilarious commentary on gossip, manipulation, and internal divisions.

title: Astérix chez les Helvètes
desc: Astérix and Obélix travel to Helvetia to find a rare plant for a poisoned Roman governor. Swiss clichés abound—neatness, fondue, banks—while the tale explores political corruption. A sharp, satirical road trip.

title: Le Domaine des dieux
desc: Caesar builds luxury Roman apartments near the village to Romanize the Gauls. Astérix and the villagers sabotage the project. A clever satire on urbanization, capitalism, and environmental preservation.

title: Les Lauriers de César
desc: Drunk boasting lands Astérix and Obélix in Rome, tasked with stealing Caesar’s laurel wreath for a stew. A zany infiltration mission through Rome’s elite society, it mocks politics, pride, and absurd promises.

title: Le Devin
desc: A phony seer fools the villagers during a storm, preying on fear and superstition. Astérix suspects a fraud and exposes him. A witty critique of gullibility, fear-mongering, and false prophets.

title: Astérix en Corse
desc: Astérix and Obélix join a Corsican rebel to free the island from Roman control. Full of jokes about Corsican vendettas, pride, siestas, and cheese, the album gently mocks insular traditions and colonial struggles.

title: Le Cadeau de César
desc: Caesar rewards a retired legionary with the Gaulish village—unbeknownst to the villagers! The new “owner” tries to take control, sparking local elections and chaos. Astérix and Obélix must restore order. This satirical tale mocks politics, ambition, and bureaucracy—Gaul-style—with timeless wit and village infighting.

title: La Grande Traversée
desc: Lost at sea, Astérix and Obélix discover a strange new land—America! They encounter Native Americans, Vikings, and odd customs. One of the earliest Franco-American parodies, it humorously explores exploration myths and cultural misunderstandings.

title: Obélix et Compagnie
desc: Caesar sends a Roman economist to ruin the village with capitalism. Obélix becomes rich selling menhirs, and the village falls into greed. A biting satire on consumerism, supply and demand, and economic bubbles.

title: Astérix chez les Belges
desc: Astérix and Obélix travel north to settle a debate on who resists Rome best. The Belgians’ unity, hearty food, and fierce pride charm them. Final album by Goscinny—humor, heart, and a tribute to cultural bonds.

title: Le Grand Fossé
desc: In a divided Gaulish village, political factions split by a trench argue constantly. Astérix helps reunite them. An allegory for the Cold War and internal division, this first solo Uderzo story leans into fantasy and diplomacy.

title: L’Odyssée d’Astérix
desc: Getafix needs rare oil from Mesopotamia. Astérix and Obélix embark on a dangerous journey through the Middle East. Spy parody meets geopolitical satire, with a Jewish caricature modeled after Golda Meir, and environmental subtext.

title: Le Fils d’Astérix
desc: A mysterious baby arrives at the village, possibly Astérix’s son. Roman agents try to abduct him. Themes of parenthood, secrets, and protection combine with baby chaos and village confusion.

title: Astérix chez Rahàzade
englishTitle: Asterix and the Magic Carpet (Film Book)
desc: Summoned to India to end a drought, the heroes travel via flying carpet with a singing fakir. They help a princess escape a cruel suitor. Eastern magic meets musical parody in this whimsical tale.

title: La Rose et le Glaive
desc: A feminist bard arrives, challenging traditional roles in the village. The Gauls face internal divisions while Caesar sends an army of female legionaries. A playful but controversial satire on gender roles and political correctness.

title: La Galère d’Obélix
englishTitle: Asterix and Obelix All at Sea
desc: Obélix accidentally falls into the magic potion cauldron again and turns to stone. The cure involves visiting Atlantis, where children never age. A surreal tale about transformation, growth, and immortality.

title: Astérix et Latraviata
desc: An actress impersonates a Roman woman to steal Caesar’s sword and helmet. Obélix’s heart is broken, and family gifts cause confusion. A theatrical farce blending love, politics, and identity.

title: Astérix et la Rentrée gauloise
desc: A collection of short stories, some classic, others new. Topics include school, holidays, and village life. A nostalgic, humorous patchwork of Gaulish slice-of-life moments, perfect for longtime fans.

title: Le Ciel lui tombe sur la tête
desc: Aliens visit the village, targeting Getafix’s magic potion. A bizarre sci-fi parody featuring characters inspired by Mickey Mouse and manga. Widely criticized for its tonal shift and lack of classic charm.

title: L’Anniversaire d’Astérix et Obélix
desc: Celebrating the duo’s 50th anniversary, this album contains imagined futures, tributes, and fantasies. Less story-driven and more reflective, it offers fan service and metafictional humor with nostalgic reverence.

title: Astérix chez les Pictes
desc: Astérix and Obélix travel to Scotland to help a stranded Pict regain his place. Kilts, bagpipes, and loch monsters abound. The first album by Ferri and Conrad revives classic humor with fresh energy.

title: Le Papyrus de César
desc: A lost chapter of Caesar’s Commentarii reveals his defeat in Gaul. A Roman whistleblower leaks it, and the village must protect it. A clever satire on media, censorship, and truth in history.

title: Astérix et la Transitalique
desc: Astérix and Obélix compete in a Roman chariot race across Italy. They face sabotage, eccentric rivals, and a mysterious masked driver. A fast-paced road race echoing classic Asterix energy and Italian humor.

title: La Fille de Vercingétorix
desc: A teenage rebel, daughter of Vercingetorix, arrives in the village. She resists Roman assimilation and inspires young Gauls. A coming-of-age tale that tackles youth identity, rebellion, and legacy.

title: Astérix et le Griffon
desc: The heroes join Getafix to protect a sacred mythical beast from Roman exploitation. Set among the Sarmatians in the frozen East, it blends ecological themes with mysticism and cultural respect.

title: L’Iris blanc
desc: A Roman psychiatrist spreads “positive thinking” to pacify Gaulish resistance. The villagers fall under his influence—except Astérix. A witty critique of toxic positivity, new-age wellness trends, and manipulation.
